column2: DELAWARE DRIVERS PERMIT TEST

1. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?

5. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column6: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column2: 6. Parking is not allowed:
column4: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column6: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 7. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 8. Blind spots are:
column4: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column8: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.

column2: 9. A person walking with a white cane or guide dog is likely to be:
10. This road sign means:
column6: You must bear either right or left
column8: A road joins from the left

column2: 11. In bad weather conditions, when visibility is low, drivers should:
column4: drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic.
column6: speed up to get off the road quickly.

column2: 12. To be able to turn quickly, your hands should be:
column4: placed outside of the steering wheel on opposite sides
column6: on the steering wheel, so they are at the 6 and 12 o'clock positions.
column8: next to each other on the top of the steering wheel.

column2: 13. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down and be prepared to stop
column6: Stop and yield to pedestrians and cross traffic
column8: Be prepared to stop if necessary

column2: 14. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
15. This road sign means:
16. This road sign means:
17. If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column4: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.
column8: turn the wheels toward the curb.

column2: 18. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
19. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 20. This sign means:
column4: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 21. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.

column2: 22. Large trucks:
column4: are more maneuverable than passenger vehicles.
column6: take longer to stop than passenger vehicles.
column8: have high-tech air brakes which allow them to stop quickly.

column2: 23. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column8: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 24. This sign means:
column4: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 25. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
26. Some roadway surfaces are more slippery during certain times or at certain places. Which of the following is more likely to be slippery on cold, wet days?

27. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
28. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers should:
column8: be ready to sound the horn.

column2: 29. At crossings with more than one track, you should cross:
column4: only when the train is out of sight.
column6: as soon as the train has passed.
column8: only when the train is well down the track.

column2: 30. Aggressive driving behaviors can include:
